title: Studied the Slinky for 52 Days Straight..

I've been a fan of pewdiepie since 6th grade (about 13 years ago) and this is the first time a comment of mine blew up on his video! Just want to say that if you're struggling right now in life, your efforts aren't going into waste! Take a second to slow down and look at yourself and how much you've grown!

Seeing how much Felix grew up and changed as a person over the course of the 10+ years I've been his fan really puts a tear in my eye, It feels surreal but not quite.

5:36 Yo ngl that slinky throwing is actually super cool
Love how Felix dressed up and kept looking at Bjorn for validation.
It is so comforting to see that Bjorn has such a great father. It heals the gaping hole in my heart, thank you for sharing it all with us Felix.

Felix, seeing you be a dad after watching your channel from the beginning sincerely makes me so happy. My wife and I had our firstborn in May of last year. Time gets beside me, and I don't watch you nearly as much as I used to. But these videos bring me joy and remind me of all the memories that your content has given me, and I look forward to sharing them with my son one day.

I'm so happy for Felix and Marzia. What a wonderful life they've made for themselves and seeing them become parents is a very satisfying experience. I'm beyond glad that things went so well for these two. I also appreciate that Felix continues to share his experiences with us. Awesome.
Felix finished a large part of the story, now he's taking his time and taking on all the side quests. Enjoying life. It's pretty cool to see, can't wait to see what's next!
Don't let this man find out about professional yoyos

This is literally so incredible to see, I always wondered what Felix would be like as a Dad and here we are seeing it in real time, gone are the days of Mr.Chair and Falcon Lord, of Jorgen and Sven, it’s now, Bjorn and Marcia and friends and living life and settling down. What a beautiful journey it’s been
Pewds being an exemplary father. The world can learn a lot from his example of love and happiness for his family.

You beat YouTube. Now he just makes whatever he wants that makes him happy and I’m so happy for you and growing from screaming at Barrels to having a beautiful family and sharing it all with us. My child was born a few weeks after Bjorn so it’s awesome to watch the vlogs and see how him and my daughter are at similar stages.
this is peak manhood, showing your skills proudly..im so happy for you and marzia, hope bjorn lives a happy life

For those that are curious, slinky "juggling" is actually really physically intensive and kind of exhausting. You need a lot of upper-body precision and strong hand-eye coordination, which requires maintaining tense muscles in your arms and core pretty much constantly. So, if you want a novel means to work out (at least in your shoulders, biceps and core), consider picking up slinky juggling.

I don’t think Felix will ever understand how happy it makes his long time viewers to see how far he’s come in life. 

Since I started watching, he’s gone from a boy in a kitchen playing games, to being financially successful, known worldwide, number 1 on the biggest video sharing platform, found a beautiful, funny, talented wife, has a healthy baby boy, and moved to a country where he finds peace and happiness. 

It brings me so much joy seeing Felix happy and successful in so many ways.
it feels like felix is gonna be that one good dad on those adventure shows where bjorn is gonna have a long exposition about how he is trying to save the world because his dad was cool or smth idk

There's something so wonderful about Felix's different vids showing him trying new skills and that you can get the hang of anything with persistence and intentional learning. Such a great thing for a kid to see and replicate.

I love that Felix is just livin his best life since “retiring”. Truly the good timeline. 
While your going around and collecting all the hobbies, I would highly recommend buying a little field guide of local Japanese wildlife and starting your real life Pokemon journey. It can be super rewarding to go out and see what lives around you, and you can have “target species” that you search for until you find to video or photograph. It would be super cool if you got to see a Japanese giant salamander….. they’re unreal

Wise words from a wise man. This advice helps me a lot as I’ve been trying to fill a sketchbook up learning how to draw. Also, Bjorn is going to grow up already knowing how to slinky without practice from just absorbing Pewds demonstrations

This was one of the most wholesome videos I've seen in a great while on youtube. I really like when you decide to learn something, and your philosophy about confidence in learning is inspiring! Much love as always!
PewDiePie being wholesome is what I needed. Thanks pewds!

Just a thought, but how about trying out a martial art and record it for a video? Especially a traditional one like jiu jitsu or karate. It's a fun way to exercise, and there's surprisingly many likeminded people there.
